name: Alice Springs Chicken
ingredients: 1/2 cup Grey Poupon Djon mustard 1 1/2 t. Vegetable oil
4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves Paprika
1 T. vegetable oil 8 slices cooked bacon
2 cups sliced mushrooms (10-­‐12 mushrooms) 1 cup shredded Monterey Jack Cheese
2 T. butter 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
steps: Salt and Pepper 2 t. chopped fresh parsley
Combine marinade ingredients in small bowl. Whip mixture for 30 sec. Pour 2/3 sauce over the chicken
breasts and marinade, covered, for 2 hours in the fridge. Chill remaining sauce. After the chicken has
marinated, preheat oven to 375 and heat up an ovenproof frying pan or skillet and put in 1 T oil over medium
heat. (If you don't have an ovenproof skillet, transfer the chicken to a baking dish for baking.) Sear chicken
for 3-­‐4min per side or until golden brown. Remove from heat but keep chicken in pan. As the chicken is
cooking, saute the sliced mushrooms in butter. Brush each searched breast with a little of the reserved
marinade. (make sure you save some that you can serve on the side later with the dish. Season chicken with
salt, pepper, and das of paprika. Stack two pieces of cooked bacon, crosswise on breasts. Spoon mushrooms
onto bacon. Spread 1/4 cup of Monterey Jack cheese onto each breast followed by 1/4 cup of cheddar.
Bake for 7-­‐10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and starting to bubble. Sprinkle with parsley.
